Interface Inventory

All Known Implementing Classes:
AcmeMfgInventory
public interface Inventory

Defines the interface for an inventory system that keeps track of inventory lots. Lots are added when groups of items arrive at a warehouse. After lots are added to inventory, items can removed from the lots as they leave the warehouse. Once a lot is empty, the lot is deleted. The lots in inventory can be displayed along with the total cost. In addition, the inventory can be queried to find out the quantity of a specific item in inventory.

Version:
2007-09
Author:
J. Bigus

Method Detail

addLot

boolean addLot(Lot lot)
Adds a lot to inventory.

Parameters:
lot - the lot to be added to inventory.
Returns:
true if the lot was added successfully, and false if the lot was not added.

deleteLot

boolean deleteLot(int lotNumber)
Deletes a lot from inventory.

Parameters:
lotNumber - the number of the lot to be deleted.
Returns:
true if the lot was deleted successfully, and false if the lot was not deleted.

getLot

Lot getLot(int lotNo)
Returns the lot with a given lot number.

Parameters:
lotNo - the number of the lot to be returned.
Returns:
the lot if it exists in inventory or null if the lot does not exist in inventory.

getLotCount

int getLotCount()
Returns the number of lots in inventory.

Returns:
the number of lots.

queryItemQty

int queryItemQty(java.lang.String itemId)
Returns the quantity on-hand in inventory for the given item id. The item id may be contained in more than one lot in the inventory. The quantity on-hand is the total number of items with that item id across all lots in inventory.

Parameters:
itemId - the id of the item to be searched for in the inventory.
Returns:
the quanity on-hand.

remove

boolean remove(java.lang.String itemId,
               int qty)
Removes a quantity of items from inventory. The items may be contained in more than one lot. If the total number of items cannot be removed, no items are removed from inventory.

Parameters:
itemId - the identifier of the items to be removed.
qty - the number of items to be removed.
Returns:
true if the items removed successfully, and false if all the items not removed.
